parameters.name: id
parameters.description: URL identifier or base64 representation of URL to scan (w/o padding)

post.description: Returns a Analysis object descriptor which can be used in the GET/analyses/{id} API endpoint to get further information about the analysis status.

Error.description:
The VirusTotal API follows the conventional HTTP response codes to indicate success or failure. Codes in the `2xx` range indicate success. Codes in the `4xx` range indicate an error in the request (e.g. a missing parameter, a resource was not found). Codes in the `5xx` range indicate an error in VirusTotal's servers and should be rare.

Unsuccessful requests return additional information about the error in JSON format.

code.description:
* `BadRequestError` (400) - The API request is invalid or malformed. The message usually provides details about why the request is not valid.
* `WrongCredentialsError` (401) - The provided API key is incorrect.
* `AuthenticationRequiredError` (401) - The operation requires an authenticated user. Verify that you have provided your API key.
* `TooManyRequestsError` (429) - Too many requests.
* `ForbiddenError` (403) - You are not allowed to perform the requested operation.
* `NotFoundError` (404) - The requested resource was not found.
* `QuotaExceededError` (429) - You have exceeded one of your quotas (minute, daily or monthly). Daily quotas are reset every day at 00:00 UTC.
You may have run out of disk space and/or number of files on your VirusTotal Monitor account.
* `UserNotActiveError` (401) - The user account is not active. Make sure you properly activated your account by following the link sent to your email.
* `InvalidArgumentError` (400) - Some of the provided arguments are incorrect.
* `AlreadyExistsError` (409) - The resource already exists.
* `TransientError` (503) - Transient server error.  Retry might work.
* `UnselectiveContentQueryError` (400) - Content search query is not selective enough.
* `UnsupportedContentQueryError` (400) - Unsupported content search query.
* `NotAvailableYet` (400) - The resource is not available yet, but will become available later.
* `FailedDependencyError` (424) - The request depended on another request and that request failed.
* `DeadlineExceededError` (504) - The operation took too long to complete.

URLObject.description:
URLs doesn't only represent information by themselves, but also can give
contextual information about files and other elements on VT.

Different URL calls may return different URL-related objects that we list here.

categories.description: they key is the partner who categorised the URL and the value is the URL's category according to that partner.

favicon.description: dictionary including difference hash and md5 hash of the URL's favicon. Only returned in premium API.

first_submission_date.description: UTC timestamp of the date where the URL was first submitted to VirusTotal.

html_meta.description: containing all meta tags (only for URLs downloading a HTML). Keys are the meta tag name and value is a list containing all values of that meta tag.

last_analysis_date.description: UTC timestamp representing last time the URL was scanned.

last_analysis_results.description: result from URL scanners. dict with scanner name as key and a dict with notes/result from that scanner as value.

category.description:
normalized result. can be:
* `harmless` - (site is not malicious),
* `undetected` - (scanner has no opinion about this site),
* `suspicious` - (scanner thinks the site is suspicious),
* `malicious` - (scanner thinks the site is malicious).

engine_name.description: complete name of the URL scanning service.

method.description: type of service given by that URL scanning service (i.e. "blacklist").

result.description: raw value returned by the URL scanner ("clean", "malicious", "suspicious", "phishing"). It may vary from scanner to scanner, hence the need for the "category" field for normalisation.

last_analysis_stats.description: number of different results from this scans.

harmless.description: number of reports saying that is harmless.

malicious.description: number of reports saying that is malicious.

suspicious.description: number of reports saying that is suspicious.

timeout.description: number of timeouts when checking this URL.

undetected.description: number of reports saying that is undetected.

last_final_url.description: if the original URL redirects, where does it end.

last_http_response_code.description: HTTP response code of the last response.

last_http_response_content_length.description: length in bytes of the content received.

last_http_response_headers.description: containing headers and values of last HTTP response.

last_modification_date.description: UTC timestamp representing last modification date.

last_submission_date.description: UTC timestamp representing last time it was sent to be analysed.

redirection_chain.description: history of redirections followed when visiting a given URL. The last URL of the chain is not included in the list since it is available at the `last_final_url` attribute.

reputation.description: value of votes from VT community.

targeted_brand.description: targeted brand info extracted from phishing engines.

times_submitted.description: number of times that URL has been checked.

total_votes.description: containing the number of positive ("harmless") and negative ("malicious") votes received from VT community.

trackers.description: contains all found trackers in that URL in a historical manner. Every key is a tracker name, which is a dictionary containing:

timestamp.description: tracker ingestion date as UNIX timestamp.
